title: Coronation Street spoilers: Sinead struggles with the severity of her illness tonight
text:
Sinead Tinker’s (Katie McGlynn) world came crashing down several several weeks ago in Coronation Street when she learned that her cancer had returned and that, this time, it’s terminal. With only a few weeks left to live, the young woman is determined to enjoy what little time she’s got left but, tonight, the severity of her illness hits her hard.

Since receiving the devastating news that her cancer had returned, Sinead has been determined to enjoy the little time she’s got left, but she was left further heartbroken last week when she learned that she only has a few weeks left to live — something which she later relayed to her friends and family during Ken’s (William Roache) 80th birthday party.

In tonight’s episode, Sinead decides to have a picnic with Daniel (Rob Mallard), Beth (Lisa George), Kirk (Andrew Whyment) and Craig (Colson Smith), but the severity of her illness well and truly hits her, as she’s forced to use a wheelchair in order to get to the location of said picnic.

Afterwards, she attempts to join in on a game of charades, but becomes pretty clear just how poorly she is, and thus the game is called short so that Sinead can be taken home.

Later, Sinead settles down on the sofa in front of the TV, ready to enjoy some time with Daniel, but she’s hit with the realisation that she won’t have many more moments like this one.

Coronation Street continues on Wednesday 16th October at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
